item.title: Syncing Git Fork with Original Repository
item.description: Why should I do this? ğŸ˜ Before submitting any pull request, syncing your forked repository with original repository is an important step to perform, as you may want to get the bug fixes or additional features to merge with your code since the time you forked the original repo. But I can do a PR instead.. ğŸ’â€â™€ï¸ You can, but that adds an extra commit into your forked repo instead of matching it with the original repo.
